meanings.sent1: The manky socks were left on the floor for days.
meanings.sent2: The alley was filled with manky garbage bags.
meanings.sent3: Even the raccoons avoided the manky dumpster behind the restaurant.
meanings.sent4: The manky pond was a breeding ground for mosquitoes.
meanings.sent5: The manky bathroom made everyone cringe.

meanings.sent1: The manky smell coming from the fridge was unbearable.
meanings.sent2: The manky taste of the expired milk made her gag.
meanings.sent3: The manky cafeteria food was rumored to be haunted.
meanings.sent4: The manky sight of the overflowing trash cans was revolting.
meanings.sent5: The manky sound of the dripping faucet echoed in the empty house.

meanings.definition: In poor condition or of poor quality
meanings.sent1: The manky old couch sagged in the middle.
meanings.sent2: The manky car barely made it up the hill.
meanings.sent3: The manky umbrella turned inside out in the strong wind.
meanings.sent4: The manky phone screen was cracked beyond repair.
meanings.sent5: The manky roof leaked every time it rained.
